brief_summary.textblock:
Patients with calcinosis cutis due to connective tissue disease get a shock wave therapy.
      The shock wave therapy will be done in 3 sessions with one week interval. The outcome
      parameters are: change in pain, size of the calcinosis, of possible ulcers and intake of
      painkillers.

        -  Trial with medical device

clinical_study.brief_title: Calcinosis Cutis: Therapeutic Effects of Extracorporeal Shock Wave Therapy (ESWT)
clinical_study.condition: Calcinosis Cutis Due to Connective Tissue Disease

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:

          -  Age of 18

          -  Calcinosis cutis due to connective tissue disease

          -  information about ESWT given

          -  Patient understands the study and signs the informed consent

        Exclusion criteria:

          -  No ESWT done

          -  cuagulopathy

          -  sepsis

          -  pregnancy

          -  pace maker

          -  severe disease in the opinion of the investigator

          -  cardiac risk with NYHA III-IV

          -  Ehlers-Danlos-Syndrome

intervention.description: Three sessions with shock wave therapy, interval of one week.
intervention.intervention_name: shock wave therapy with Modulith SLK (Storz)

facility.name: University Hospital Zurich, Division of Rheumatology

overall_official.affiliation: University Hospital Zurich, Division of Rheumatology

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
